newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian govt looks at selling art collection.
newsitem.headline: Australian govt looks at selling art collection.

text.p: The Australian government is looking at selling its art collection, Arts Minister Richard Alston said on Wednesday.

"There are ongoing discussions between ministers on the matter to consider the appropriateness of the Commonwealth's (federal government's) continued involvement," Alston told parliament in response to an opposition query.
"What we're being asked to consider is whether that type of operation can be conducted in the private sector," Alston said.
The collection, held by the government agency Artbank, was valued at about A$11 million, he said.
The Department of Communications and the Arts commissioned a scoping study several months ago to examine the ongoing effectiveness of Artbank, he said.
The Liberal-National government has sold several government assets since taking office in March last year.
